question.body: Which superficial part of the forebrain receives all the somatosensory input for sensory perception relayed through the thalamus from body receptors, such as detecting touch, pressure and temperature?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This part of the frontal lobe is also known as the primary motor area as the origin of control of conscious skeletal muscle contraction.
Correct. This part of the parietal lobe is also known as the primary somatosensory area as the end point for sensory signals from somatic body receptors.
Incorrect. This is a cortical region around the corpus callosum and thalamus involved in higher brain functions.
Incorrect. This is a cortical region around the thalamus involved in motor control.
Incorrect. This is a lobe of the cerebral cortex deep to the temporal and parietal lobes.

question.body: Which part of the forebrain includes the hippocampus and amygdala involved in emotions and memory?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This part of the frontal lobe is also known as the primary motor area as the origin of control of conscious skeletal muscle contraction.
Incorrect. This part of the parietal lobe is also known as the primary somatosensory area as the end point for sensory signals from somatic body receptors.
Correct. This cortical region around the corpus callosum and thalamus is involved in smell, memory and emotions, especially strong emotions such as anger or fear.
Incorrect. This is a cortical region around the thalamus involved in motor control.

Incorrect. This is a lobe of the cerebral cortex deep to the temporal and parietal lobes that, while still not clearly understood, appears to play a role in awareness and interpretation of some sensations.
